feels.name: Alarm
feels.quote: Dorothea felt a shock of alarm: every one noticed her sudden paleness as she looked up immediately at her uncle.
feels.exactPlace: In the presence of her uncle and Mr. Casaubon

feels.name: Unpleasantness
feels.quote: Dorothea felt that every word of her uncle’s was about as pleasant as a grain of sand in the eye to Mr. Casaubon.
feels.exactPlace: In the presence of her uncle and Mr. Casaubon

feels.name: Irritation
feels.quote: Mr. Casaubon bowed with cold politeness, mastering his irritation.
feels.exactPlace: In the presence of Mr. Brooke and Dorothea

feels.name: Curiosity
feels.quote: Mrs. Cadwallader’s eyes, diverted from the churchyard, saw a good deal of dumb show which was not so intelligible to her as she could have desired.

Places.name: The manor window
Places.description: Where Mrs. Cadwallader observed the funeral
